iati-activity.title: Advancing Gender Equality in
iati-activity.description: Advancing and Sustaining Gender Equality Gains in Rwanda

transaction.disbursement-channel: Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Harmonized gender capacity building plan 2. % of National Gender Machinery recommendations developed and submitted for adoption 3. Number of sectors with a gender strategy 4. Number of ministries with gender budget statements 5. Timely submission of national reports on gender.

target.comment: 1. 2 new districts with gender sector strategy 2. 30 districts, 14 ministries with gender budget statement 3. 75 % of FFRP members benefited from an induction course , 40 MPs, 21 planners and 14 chief trained in Gender Responsive Budgeting, 4. 4 gender mainstreaming policy briefs/guidelines developed 5. 5 national, 2 international dialogues/events on gender equality and GBV organized 6. 3 sectors and 10 districts with gender profiles

actual.comment: 1. The Ministry of Gender and Family Promotion (MIGEPROF)has developed gender strategy for 2 sectors of activities: Private Sector and Local government. Both strategies have been validated by stakeholders but they are still waiting for approval by the MIGEPROF and its partners Ministry of Local Government (MINALOC) and Private Sector Federation. 2. 30 districts and all ministries have developed their gender budget statements for 2014-2015 and 2015-2016 fiscal years 3. Fifty (50) new Parliamentarians members of the Rwanda Women Parliamentary Forum (FFRP) were equipped with required knowledge to play oversight role with gender lens. The knowledge acquired enabled the Members of Parliament to analyze and pass gender sensitive bills and budget starting with the 2014/15 national budget and gender budget statement approval. Over 14 Chief budget managers, 21 planners and budget officers, 28 district staff in charge of gender and family promotion enhanced their skills in gender responsive budgeting through a five day training on Gender Responsive Budgeting. It is expected that the skills acquired will facilitate them to address gender related issues in national and district planning and budgeting processes. This training also contributed to the improvement of the quality of the 2015-2016 Gender budget statement. 4. 3 gender mainstreaming policy briefs/guidelines were developed: GBV Monitoring Guidelines were produced and shared with the CSOs by Gender Monitoring Office (GMO); the Parents evening (Umugoroba wAbabyeyi) guidelines reviewed; and the Familys Performance Contract (IMIHIGO) notebook produced. 5. 7 national and 3 international events on gender equality and GBV have been organized; these are: national events: the National Women Leaders Summit by Ministry of Gender and family Promotion (MIGEPROF); the Dialogue on better coordination and effectiveness of womens empowerment initiatives at provincial level by the Forum for Women Parliamentarians (FFRP), the Di

iati-activity.title: Capacity Development Support
iati-activity.description: The project aims at building capacity for local and national government entities and equipping them with skills and tools to deliver on their responsibility to implement government policies, service delivery, and social & economic development.

Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Strengthened and functional Coordination mechanism Government of government policies and programmes in place

baseline.comment: Weakness in Coordination mechanism during implementation and monitoring of government policies and programmes.

target.comment: 1. The programme will support to enhance the capacity of PM office 2. the 30 Districts by training/coaching the staffs in the mainstreaming of the Monitoring and Evaluation framework during monitoring of government policies and programmes. 3. Support to promote investments and resources mobilization by 10% in the 30 Districts and in Rwanda Development 4. Board (RDB) will be enhanced. 5. A National Qualification and Competency Framework for Rwanda that will enhance coordination of activities of programmes related to capacity building initiatives will be established by National Capacity 6. Building Secretariat (NCBS). 7. Efforts to comprehensively review the Rwandan capital market development will be enhanced through drafting of project legislation and tax framework to support in the financial sector development through Ministry of Finance.

actual.comment: 1. An Evaluation National policy at the Prime Ministers' office has been drafted. 2. District coaches supported the review and improvement in the quality of the Districts annual plans and budgets for the financial year 2015/2016. 3. Communications and advocacy strategy for the National Statistical System (NSS) The ICT technical advisor at National Institute of Statistics (NISR). 4. project dubbed Building a Regional Business and Financial Centre for Eastern and Central Africa has been developed in Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning (MINECOFIN). 5. Investment experts at RDB mapped potential investors and branding Rwanda as an investment and tourism destination.

location.name: Kigali
location.activity-description: Support for the Development and implementation of a Green Economy Approach to Rwanda's Economic Transformation.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Output 3: 2 demo green villages established for the up-scaling programmes in Rwanda with climate smart agriculture practices Output 4: Rwanda National SE4ALL Investment Prospectuses (IPs) developed. Output 5: 5-1) Environmental Unit within Rwanda National Police is established and equipped to support Rwandas green growth. 5-2) All sectors costed for the implementation of the Green Growth and Climate Resilience Strategy.

baseline.comment: Output 3: Three districts with an established demo green village. Output 4: Not provided Output 5: Not provided

target.comment: Output 3: Two demo green villages established for the up-scaling programmes in Rwanda with climate smart agriculture practices Output 4: Rwanda National SE4ALL Investment Prospectuses (IPs) developed Output 5: Environmental Unit within Rwanda National Police is established and equipped to support Rwandas green growth. Output 6: Joint Programme Manager is recruited

actual.comment: 3-1 Village Site validation and approval with stakeholders for demo green Village implementation 3-2 Study tour for the demo Village committees to pilot Model villages in Rubaya green Village (Gicumbi district) and Nyagatovu IDP Model Village (Kayonza district) 3-3 Workshops for Local Gov'ts officials and stakeholders on demo green village project implementation procedures/guidelines 3-4 Procurement of a consulting firm to develop a Village-greening business plan for two villages. 5-1 EPU has been set up.

indicator.description: 1. Number of pro poor household relocated from fragile Ecosystem to safe land, 2. number hectares of fragile Ecosystems rehabilitated and protected 3. indicator.description: 1) Number of sector policy reflecting environment, climate change, disaster risk reduction and gender considerations 2) Number of policies, regulations and legislation formulated or refined to reflect new national priorities 3) Number of outreach material produced and disseminated 4) Number of partnership between ministry of natural resources and other institutions established 5) A firm for result based management of the ministry of natural resources hired

iati-activity.title: STRENGTHENING CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATIONS (CSOs)
iati-activity.description: The main objective of this programme is to strengthen the capacities of the CSOs to enable them hold the public and private sectors to account as well as advocate for the rights of the weak and marginalized sections of the Rwandan society.
